intro: Exostema eggersii, commonly known as the silverleaf sterculia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Sterculiaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by elongated, woody fruits. Exostema eggersii is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
